author: _shemnon
content:
Working on EIP-6780, and I'm looking for some clarifications.
Pre-EIP if an account self-destructed with itself as beneficiary it would wind up losing it's ether (supported by https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/master/src/ethereum/homestead/vm/instructions/system.py#L354-L357).

Post EIP, should that set-to-zero be replaced with ether-stays-in-account?  If so I think it deserves a callout in the EIP as a change in behavior, even though it could be derived.
